required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Exenatide Once Weekly for Smoking Cessation
clinical_study.official_title: Exenatide Once Weekly for Smoking Cessation: A Randomized Clinical Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to identify a potential new treatment for smoking cessation.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Self-Reported Abstinence and Who Were Biochemically Verified as Abstinent Via Expired CO Level of ≤ 5ppm
Post-quit Craving as Assessed by the Questionnaire of Smoking Urges
primary_outcome.description: Questionnaire of Smoking Urges (QSU) is a 10-item scale (total score range = 10-70, a lower score indicates lower cravings for cigarettes) that evaluates the intention and desire to smoke and anticipation of relief from withdrawal-associated negative affect.

primary_outcome.measure: Withdrawal Symptoms as Assessed by the Wisconsin Smoking Withdrawal Scale
primary_outcome.description: The Wisconsin Smoking Withdrawal Scale is a 28-item questionnaire designed to assess different aspects of the smoking withdrawal syndrome. Participants rate each item on a Likert scale from zero (strongly disagree) to four (strongly agree). Total score ranges from 0 to 112, with a higher score indicating greater withdrawal.

primary_outcome.measure: Cue-induced Craving for Cigarettes Following Virtual Reality Exposure as Assessed by the Questionnaire of Smoking Urges
primary_outcome.description: Questionnaire of Smoking Urges (QSU) is a 10-item scale (total score range = 10-70, a lower score indicates lower cravings for cigarettes) that evaluates the intention and desire to smoke and anticipation of relief from withdrawal-associated negative affect.

primary_outcome.measure: Cue-induced Craving for Cigarettes Following Virtual Reality Exposure as Assessed by the Questionnaire of Smoking Urges
primary_outcome.description: Questionnaire of Smoking Urges (QSU) is a 10-item scale (total score range = 10-70, a lower score indicates lower cravings for cigarettes) that evaluates the intention and desire to smoke and anticipation of relief from withdrawal-associated negative affect.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Self-Reported Abstinence and Who Were Biochemically Verified as Abstinent Via Expired CO Level of ≤ 5ppm
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 weeks (1 week after end of treatment)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Self-Reported Abstinence and Who Were Biochemically Verified as Abstinent Via Expired CO Level of ≤ 5ppm
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10 weeks (4 weeks after end of treatment)

secondary_outcome.measure: Post-quit Craving as Assessed by the Questionnaire of Smoking Urges
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 weeks (1 week after end of treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire of Smoking Urges (QSU) is a 10-item scale (total score range = 10-70, a lower score indicates lower cravings for cigarettes) that evaluates the intention and desire to smoke and anticipation of relief from withdrawal-associated negative affect.

secondary_outcome.measure: Post-quit Craving as Assessed by the Questionnaire of Smoking Urges
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10 weeks (4 weeks after end of treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire of Smoking Urges (QSU) is a 10-item scale (total score range = 10-70, a lower score indicates lower cravings for cigarettes) that evaluates the intention and desire to smoke and anticipation of relief from withdrawal-associated negative affect.

arm_group.description: Once weekly exenatide Injectable Product, Nicotine Replacement Therapy (NRT) Patch, smoking cessation counseling
Once weekly placebo, Nicotine Replacement Therapy (NRT) Patch, smoking cessation counseling

intervention.description: Exenatide Injectable Product will be administered at a dose of 2 mg subcutaneously once a week for 6 weeks.
Brief individual behavioral smoking cessation counseling.

overall_official.affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

facility.name: The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston

reference.citation: Yammine L, Kosten TR, Cinciripini PM, Green CE, Meininger JC, Minnix JA, Newton TF. Exenatide once weekly for smoking cessation: study protocol for a randomized clinical trial. Medicine (Baltimore). 2018 Jan;97(2):e9567. doi: 10.1097/MD.0000000000009567.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 1 participant in the exenatide arm did not receive exenatide, and 1 participant in the placebo arm did not receive placebo.

group.title: Exenatide Plus NRT Plus Counseling
group.description: Once weekly exenatide Injectable Product, Nicotine Replacement Therapy (NRT) Patch, smoking cessation counseling Exenatide: Exenatide Injectable Product will be administered at a dose of 2 mg subcutaneously once a week for 6 weeks. NRT: Nicotine Patch (21mg) / 24 hours. Counseling: Brief individual behavioral smoking cessation counseling.

group.title: Placebo Plus NRT Plus Counseling
group.description: Once weekly placebo, Nicotine Replacement Therapy (NRT) Patch, smoking cessation counseling NRT: Nicotine Patch (21mg) / 24 hours. Counseling: Brief individual behavioral smoking cessation counseling. Placebo: Normal saline.

group.title: Exenatide Plus NRT Plus Counseling
group.description: Once weekly exenatide Injectable Product, Nicotine Replacement Therapy (NRT) Patch, smoking cessation counseling Exenatide: Exenatide Injectable Product will be administered at a dose of 2 mg subcutaneously once a week for 6 weeks. NRT: Nicotine Patch (21mg) / 24 hours. Counseling: Brief individual behavioral smoking cessation counseling.

group.title: Placebo Plus NRT Plus Counseling
group.description: Once weekly placebo, Nicotine Replacement Therapy (NRT) Patch, smoking cessation counseling NRT: Nicotine Patch (21mg) / 24 hours. Counseling: Brief individual behavioral smoking cessation counseling. Placebo: Normal saline.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Sex: Female, Male
Race/Ethnicity, Customized
Region of Enrollment
Marital Status
Highest Level of Education
Household Income
Cigarettes Smoked per Day
Years of Regular Smoking
Nicotine Dependence as Assessed by the Fagerstrom Test for Nicotine Dependence (FTND)
measure.description: Total score ranges from 0-10. The higher the total Fagerström score, the more intense the physical dependence on nicotine.

measure.title: Positive Affect as Assessed by the Positive and Negative Affect Schedule (PANAS)
measure.description: Score ranges from 10-50, with a higher score representing higher levels of Positive Affect.

measure.title: Negative Affect as Assessed by the Positive and Negative Affect Schedule (PANAS)
measure.description: Score ranges from 10-50, with a higher score representing higher levels of Negative Affect.

measure.title: Depressive Symptoms as Assessed by the Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ-8)
measure.description: Total score ranges from 0 to 24, with a higher score indicating greater depression.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Self-Reported Abstinence and Who Were Biochemically Verified as Abstinent Via Expired CO Level of ≤ 5ppm

group.title: Exenatide Plus NRT Plus Counseling
group.description: Once weekly exenatide Injectable Product, Nicotine Replacement Therapy (NRT) Patch, smoking cessation counseling Exenatide: Exenatide Injectable Product will be administered at a dose of 2 mg subcutaneously once a week for 6 weeks. NRT: Nicotine Patch (21mg) / 24 hours. Counseling: Brief individual behavioral smoking cessation counseling.

group.title: Placebo Plus NRT Plus Counseling
group.description: Once weekly placebo, Nicotine Replacement Therapy (NRT) Patch, smoking cessation counseling NRT: Nicotine Patch (21mg) / 24 hours. Counseling: Brief individual behavioral smoking cessation counseling. Placebo: Normal saline.

measure.title: Number of Participants Who Self-Reported Abstinence and Who Were Biochemically Verified as Abstinent Via Expired CO Level of ≤ 5ppm

outcome.title: Post-quit Craving as Assessed by the Questionnaire of Smoking Urges
outcome.description: Questionnaire of Smoking Urges (QSU) is a 10-item scale (total score range = 10-70, a lower score indicates lower cravings for cigarettes) that evaluates the intention and desire to smoke and anticipation of relief from withdrawal-associated negative affect.
outcome.population: Data were not collected for 7 participants in the Exenatide plus NRT plus counseling arm and 6 participants in the Placebo plus NRT plus counseling arm. Overall Number of Participants Analyzed reflects participants who completed the study visit.

measure.population: Data were not collected for 7 participants in the Exenatide plus NRT plus counseling arm and 6 participants in the Placebo plus NRT plus counseling arm. Overall Number of Participants Analyzed reflects participants who completed the study visit.

outcome.description: The Wisconsin Smoking Withdrawal Scale is a 28-item questionnaire designed to assess different aspects of the smoking withdrawal syndrome. Participants rate each item on a Likert scale from zero (strongly disagree) to four (strongly agree). Total score ranges from 0 to 112, with a higher score indicating greater withdrawal.
outcome.population: Data were not collected for 7 participants in the Exenatide plus NRT plus counseling arm and 6 participants in the Placebo plus NRT plus counseling arm. Overall Number of Participants Analyzed reflects participants who completed the study visit.

outcome.title: Cue-induced Craving for Cigarettes Following Virtual Reality Exposure as Assessed by the Questionnaire of Smoking Urges
outcome.description: Questionnaire of Smoking Urges (QSU) is a 10-item scale (total score range = 10-70, a lower score indicates lower cravings for cigarettes) that evaluates the intention and desire to smoke and anticipation of relief from withdrawal-associated negative affect.
outcome.population: Virtual reality exposure was not done due to transfer of the study to a different site; therefore, data for this outcome measure were not collected.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Self-Reported Abstinence and Who Were Biochemically Verified as Abstinent Via Expired CO Level of ≤ 5ppm
outcome.time_frame: 7 weeks (1 week after end of treatment)
outcome.population: Data were not collected for 22 participants in the Exenatide plus NRT plus counseling arm and 30 participants in the Placebo plus NRT plus counseling arm. The Overall Number of Participants Analyzed reflects the number of participants who were abstinent [self-reported and verified by expired carbon monoxide (CO) levels (CO≤5 ppm)] at 6 weeks (end of treatment).

group.title: Exenatide Plus NRT Plus Counseling
group.description: Once weekly exenatide Injectable Product, Nicotine Replacement Therapy (NRT) Patch, smoking cessation counseling Exenatide: Exenatide Injectable Product will be administered at a dose of 2 mg subcutaneously once a week for 6 weeks. NRT: Nicotine Patch (21mg) / 24 hours. Counseling: Brief individual behavioral smoking cessation counseling.

outcome.population: Data were not collected for 25 participants in the Exenatide plus NRT plus counseling arm and 32 participants in the Placebo plus NRT plus counseling arm. The Overall Number of Participants Analyzed reflects those who completed the study visit.

outcome.time_frame: 10 weeks (4 weeks after end of treatment)
outcome.population: Data were not collected for 30 participants in the Exenatide plus NRT plus counseling arm and 37 participants in the Placebo plus NRT plus counseling arm. The Overall Number of Participants Analyzed reflects those who completed the study visit.

event.sub_title: Pruritus at the site of nicotine patch application

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Luba Yammine, PhD, APRN, FNP-C, Associate Professor
